result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J Nejdlik was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Possession of Cocaine, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  
The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Concurrent with: with credit for 195 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain employment and/or school and/or vocational training.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.
Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.

Medically assisted treatment if appropriate.
Use a physician disclosure form.
Cognitive intervention programming.
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Court does not suspend driving privileges.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.  Unless medically assisted treatment. Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.

supervisions.notes: Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges DURING EXTENDED SUPERVISION or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

09-08-15/ Carl Ashley
The Court ordered that the JOC in case 14CF00458 shall be amended to reflect 195 days of sentence credit on each Count
Concurrent with: with credit for 195 days time served. No electronic monitoring. 
Court does not suspend driving privileges.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel J Nejdlik

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original PLEA/SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (29 pages) commencing JULY 29, 2015 received and filed.
As to CR-212 & 204, JOC's reflect 09-08-14 Court order for 195 days of sentence credit on each Count
Order Amending Judgments of Conviction, signed and filed.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Carl Ashley, Br. 33, for review. crt

Defendant Daniel J Nejdlik in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Defendant Daniel J Nejdlik in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Statements made as to sentencing. 
COUNT 2 - CONCURRENT:
Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 180 days time served.   No electronic monitoring. 

Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges DURING EXTENDED SUPERVISION or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Court does not suspend driving privileges.

COUNT 1 - CONCURRENT:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 36 MONTHS, with credit for 180 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 18 MONTHS.  The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Medically assisted treatment if appropriate.
* Use a physician disclosure form.
* Cognitive intervention programming.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.  Unless medically assisted treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Obtain and maintain employment and/or school and/or vocational training.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court does not suspend driving privileges.

  Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Defense request an adjournment for an global resolution.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 6.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance and State's motion, the court revoked the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in br. 6.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Per email from case manager.  Case is adjourned from 12/12/2014 to 12/18/2014 at 9:30am. lms

Court set bail at $500 PR bond.  Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION and transport to residential treatment center.  Review hearing scheduled for 12-12-2014 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Daniel J Nejdlik in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Defendant Daniel J Nejdlik in custody.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract.
AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2:  The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months to 18 months.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.
Defendant has been accepted into Drug Treatment Court.  Case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.

Defendant Daniel J Nejdlik in court with attorney Victoria M. McCandless.  Defendant Daniel J Nejdlik in custody.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for plea and sentencing.  Defendant will be accepted into drug treatment court.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 1/9/2015 at 9:00 am, branch 3.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision with WCS Repeat Intoxicated Driver Intervention program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Scram ordered, and no drug paraphernalia.

Attorney Victoria M. McCandless in court, defendant Daniel J Nejdlik not in court, in custody.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant was picked up on a warrant.  Defense is trying to get defendant into drug treatment court.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 10/30/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.
No reply from surety or defendant.

Public Defender's office contacted attorney McCandless who requested to change the 8/19/2014 court date.  Attorney McCandless has agreed to keep this case.  Case adjourned for return on warrant on 8/27/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw
Defendant was picked up on a warrant.  Clerk contacted the Public Defender's office.  Case adjourned for return on warrant on 8/19/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw
Notice of bail/bond forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($150.00) ad
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report violation received and filed.  aw

Defendant Daniel J Nejdlik not in court.  Dennis P Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant did not show up for plea hearing yesterday.  Court issued a warrant previously.  Bench warrant remains in effect.  aw
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention program report, recevied and filed.  aw
Justice Point violation report received and filed.  aw
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 150.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Daniel J Nejdlik not in court.  No Assistant District Attorney appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
NO FILE IN COURT.  Court addresses violation report.  Defendant did not go to WCS today, and case worker has left messages for him.  He also had a refusal on Friday, and did not appear to give a sample on Monday, when ordered.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Clerk contacted attorney McCandless of today's proceedings.  Next court date remains on calendar.  aw
WCS office contact report, received and filed.  aw

Court received a violation report today.  Court was advised that the defendant is scheduled for SCRAM removal as there is only funding for 40 days.  Defendnat has a appointment today at 2:30 pm, and has not reported as of 3:15 pm.  Defendant's case manager, Veronica, to advise court by email on Monday if defendant appeared for appointment, and the results of his drug and alcohol test, if he appears for scheduled contact.  aw

Defendant Daniel J Nejdlik in court with attorney Victoria M. McCandless.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for projected guilty plea on 5/1/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court reminds defendant to continue with Justice Point.  Court reminds defense counsel to inform the state if the defendant is in custody on the next court date to have him produced.  aw  Plea hearing scheduled for May 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention program report, received and filed.

Defendant Daniel J Nejdlik in court.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case worker present in court.
NO FILE IN COURT. 
COURT ADDRESSES VIOLATION REPORT.  
 
Defendant has missed his contacts with Justice Point.  Court informs defendant that he must see his agent twice per week to have his SCRAM unit downloaded.  Defendant must also make all appointments with Justice Point, unless he is in the hospital with verification from the doctor.  Court WILL MODIFY BAIL for any violations, and issue a warrant if he fails to appear.  Defendant ordered to go to Justice Point after court today to be drug tested, and have his unit downloaded.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription, and to remain absolutely sober.  NO Alcohol.  Clerk contacted attorney McCandless and advised her of today's proceedings.   aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed due to missed office contact.  aw

14RM009027  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
2/19/14 vf
Court orders other terms and conditions of bail to remain the same.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail AMENDED TO $150 CASH.

Defendant Daniel J Nejdlik in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Defendant Daniel J Nejdlik in custody.  Hanna Kolberg for Dennis P Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  To be monitored by drug testing.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Daniel J Nejdlik in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Defendant Daniel J Nejdlik in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant enters a plea of not guilty as to misdemeanor count 2.
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
